ygData.subject: Re: More Charismat Carrilon data
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm, possibly but I believe the song adds the target s faction to you, soif you suddenly became a member of their faction wouldn t they all become amiable
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm, possibly but I believe the song adds the target's faction to you, soif
you suddenly became a member of their faction wouldn't they all become
amiable since you are 'one of the boys'?

If so probably no effect on mobs without a faction

-----Original Message-----
From: David.Lynam@... [mailto:David.Lynam@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 1:28 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] More Charismat Carrilon data


From: David.Lynam@...

I'd think that the reason for this is that it affects how that character's
associated faction views you, rather than how that character itself views
you. It may have been a corner cut for the programmers, or it may have been
designed this way

-----Original Message-----
From: John Robertson [mailto:johnr@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 2:26 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] More Charismat Carrilon data


From: "John Robertson" <johnr@...>


- When you change one NPC to Amiable, all OTHERS of that type seem to change
as
well. So if you change a dwarf merchant who was apprehensive toward you,
all
others in the same zone who were apprehensive seem to change as well. (This
seems like a bug).

Jyzan
